definition: to prevail/to have one's way/to get away with it
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to show off/to flaunt/to carry out or succeed in a scheme/to indulge/to give free rein to

sentences.english: He mingled among them with evil designs.
sentences.chinese: 他的罪恶阴谋未能得逞。

sentences.english: Cover up the keypad to foil the bad guys' plan.
sentences.chinese: 输入号码时盖好你的键盘，别让那些坏家伙得逞。
他的罪恶企图未能得逞。

sentences.english: Their attempt to defame China will get nowhere.
sentences.chinese: 这些人利用谣言抹黑中国的企图决不会得逞。

sentences.english: Change as suicide successful guangzhou city. china the bride.
sentences.chinese: 变身为自杀得逞的待嫁新娘。

sentences.english: The heavy steel doors mocked the attempts of the thieves to open the safe.
sentences.chinese: 厚重的铁门使盗贼开启保险箱的企图无法得逞。

sentences.english: Hitler's ambition was falsified at last.
sentences.chinese: 希特勒的野心最终未能得逞。
他的罪恶阴谋未能得逞。

sentences.english: This conspiracy of Britain is frustrated.
sentences.chinese: 英国的这一阴谋未能得逞。

sentences.english: Knavery may serve for a turn , but honesty is best at the long run .
sentences.chinese: 欺诈也许能得逞一时，诚实却能长存万世。

sentences.english: With this knowledge, perhaps, eventually, fear will not prevail.
sentences.chinese: 有了这方面的知识，也许恐惧终将不会得逞。

sentences.english: So will the attack on unions succeed?
sentences.chinese: 那么，究竟这场针对工会的攻击会得逞吗？

sentences.english: The thief was foiled in his attempt to enter the house.
sentences.chinese: 小偷进屋的企图未能得逞。

sentences.english: The temptation to exploit consumers usually prevails unless it is curbed.
sentences.chinese: 剥削消费者的诱惑除非加以限制，否则就会得逞。

sentences.english: The strange man tried to blackmail the clerk into helping him draw the money, but he failed.
sentences.chinese: 陌生人想讹诈职员迫使他帮他取出钱，但未能得逞。

sentences.english: The candidate tried to tamper with the voters but in vain.
sentences.chinese: 候选人企图收买投票人，但未能得逞。

definition: trick/ruse/crafty scheme
to play dirty tricks/to be up to mischief
to submit/to give in
evil plan/evil schemes
to penetrate/to see through
to run away/to escape
to make reprisals/to retaliate/revenge/retaliation
to leave the matter at that/to be prepared to let go/to be willing to take things lying down
advantageous/favorable/to benefit at others' expense/to take unfair advantage
to escape without trace (idiom); to make one's getaway (from the scene of a crime)/to show a clean pair of heels
taken in (by sb's deceit)/to be fooled/to be duped
to have an opportunity that one can exploit (idiom)
usual trick/old tactics
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to play tricks on sb
to take advantage of sb's difficulties (idiom)
